intro: Lagenandra nairii, commonly known as the Malabar carambola, is a tropical plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically harvested when they turn a yellowish color. Lagenandra nairii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Its growth habits make it suitable for shady or semi-shaded environments in gardens.
